synopsis.text: This feature-length spin-off of [rovilink="V"]Batman: The Animated Series[/rovilink] follows the dynamic duo as they battle their ice cold, age old enemy, Mr. Freeze. In his latest nefarious plot, Mr. Freeze has abducted Batgirl as the organ donor needed for a deadly experiment meant to reanimate his old wife, who, until her cryogenic chamber was shattered, had been frozen until a cure was found for her otherwise terminal heart disease. Unless Batman and Robin can rescue her on time, Batgirl will lose her life in a highly illegal heart transplant operation. Featured voices include [rovilink="P"]Kevin Conroy[/rovilink] as Batman and [rovilink="P"]Michael Ansara[/rovilink] as the infamously monotone Mr. Freeze.
synopsis.author: Tracie Cooper

messages.text: Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.

movie.title: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Part 2

synopsis.text: [rovilink="P"]Frank Miller[/rovilink]'s seminal graphic novel The Dark Knight Returns is adapted for the small screen with a sprawling [rovilink="O"]Warner Premiere[/rovilink] animated film series that finds an old and weary Bruce Wayne (voiced by [rovilink="V"]Robocop[/rovilink] himself, [rovilink="P"]Peter Weller[/rovilink]) donning the cape and cowl once again after a long retirement. Covering the final two issues of the series, [rovilink="V"]Part 2[/rovilink] pits the outlawed crusader against his nemesis, The Joker (voiced by [rovilink="V"]LOST[/rovilink]'s [rovilink="P"]Michael Emerson[/rovilink]), as well as a militarized Superman, who carries out justice in the name of the United States of America. [rovilink="P"]Ariel Winter[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Modern Family[/rovilink]) plays a female version of Robin, with [rovilink="V"]Dark Shadows[/rovilink]' [rovilink="P"]David Selby[/rovilink] rounding out the voice cast. [rovilink="P"]Jay Oliva[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Green Lantern: Emerald Knights[/rovilink] directs from a script by [rovilink="P"]Bob Goodman[/rovilink].
synopsis.author: Jeremy Wheeler

synopsis.text: A diabolical villain who seems to know Batman's every move sets out to clean up the streets of Gotham for good and destroy the caped crime-fighter in the process. Every night, Batman protects the citizens of Gotham from the shadows. But lately another vigilante has been prowling the streets, and his merciless methods are more frightening than reassuring. Now, as the Red Hood commences to exterminating the scum of the city with extreme prejudice, the Joker resurfaces to taunt his old nemesis by digging up some skeletons that were best left buried.
synopsis.author: Jason Buchanan

synopsis.text: This stylish animated adventure is based on the '90s animated television series, which in turn is based on the original comics and [rovilink="P  9825"]Tim Burton's[/rovilink] live action "Batman" films. Unlike the campy 1960s version of Batman, this version is half-mad from the superhero's obsession with justice. It is only his unusual sense of ethics that keeps him from becoming a full-blown psychotic. The story describes the origins of Batman as it follows the Dark Knight's attempts to capture the elusive, deadly Phantasm who kills a crime lord and makes it look as if Batman did it, causing a media smear campaign against the Caped Crusader. At the same time, millionaire Bruce Wayne holds a party at his mansion. There he meets Councilman Arthur Reeves, the man behind the accusations. Reeves derides playboy Wayne for allowing his college sweetheart Andrea Beaumont to leave him. Suddenly Wayne flashes back to his pre-Batman days. He remembers how he met her while visiting his parents' graves to renew his vow that he would spend his life fighting crime to avenge their wrongful deaths. He has already devised an early version of his alter-ego Batman, but that is nearly forgotten when he falls in love with Andrea. The story then jumps from past to present and back as the mysterious Phantasm strikes again. Batman continues his investigation and discovers a disturbing link between Andrea, who suddenly shows up after many years absence, and the villain. Meanwhile, the Phantasm, feeling that Batman is too close to learning his/her identity hires the Joker to kill him. But the Joker has his own agenda and much action ensues before the mystery of the Phantasm identity is solved, Batman clears his name, and justice is served. This film was originally made to go straight to video, Warner's studio liked it enough to release it theatrically. Some of the violence may be inappropriate for very young children.
synopsis.author: Sandra Brennan

synopsis.text: The Dark Knight (voice of [rovilink="P"]Jason O'Mara[/rovilink]) discovers that he has a son with Talia al Ghul (voice of [rovilink="P"]Morena Baccarin[/rovilink]), and that the young boy is driven by the same fiery vengeance as his crime-fighting father in this adaptation of the 2006 comic book arc by [rovilink="P"]Grant Morrison[/rovilink]. Trained as a young boy by the League of Assassins, Batman and Talia's son Damian (voice of [rovilink="P"]Stuart Allan[/rovilink]) grows convinced that his grandfather Ra's al Ghul was killed by the villainous Deathstroke (voice of [rovilink="P"]Thomas Gibson[/rovilink]). Donning Robin's suit, Damian sets out in search of violent retribution.
synopsis.author: Jason Buchanan

synopsis.text: Tongue-in-cheek humor prevails in [rovilink="V     4278"]Batman[/rovilink], a witty homage to the Dynamic Duo's exaggerated exploits. The Caped Crusaders ([rovilink="P 75587"]Adam West[/rovilink] and [rovilink="P 74605"]Burt Ward[/rovilink]) are called in as a last resort when the criminal masterminds of the millennium team up to conquer Gotham City by turning the U.N. Security Council into dehydrated dust; among the villains are the Joker ([rovilink="P 61318"]Cesar Romero[/rovilink]), Catwoman ([rovilink="P 48556"]Lee Meriwether[/rovilink]), the Riddler ([rovilink="P 27897"]Frank Gorshin[/rovilink]), and the Penguin ([rovilink="P102566"]Burgess Meredith[/rovilink]). The entire cast is excellent, particularly [rovilink="P 75587"]West[/rovilink] and [rovilink="P 74605"]Ward[/rovilink], who distinguish themselves among a standout list with hilariously straight-faced performances. The film includes some truly memorable scenes, highlighted by a particularly tenacious shark with a vertical leap that would put [rovilink="P 75171"]Spud Webb[/rovilink] to shame and a bomb on the waterfront with no place to explode (nuns, infants and lovebirds beware!).
synopsis.author: Jeremy Beday

synopsis.text: In this first sequel to 1989's [rovilink="V     4278"]Batman[/rovilink], the Caped Crusader ([rovilink="P 37277"]Michael Keaton[/rovilink]) is up against the Penguin ([rovilink="P"]Danny DeVito[/rovilink]), the hideously deformed scion of a wealthy Gotham City family. The Penguin plots with evil businessman Max Schreck ([rovilink="P 74206"]Christopher Walken[/rovilink]) to become mayor and then turn Gotham into a cathedral of crime. Upon overhearing these plans, Schreck's mousy secretary Selena Kyle ([rovilink="P 56469"]Michelle Pfeiffer[/rovilink]) is tossed from a high-rise window by her boss. Rescued by a covey of kittens, Selena transforms into the leather-clad Catwoman. In this guise, she teams with the Penguin and Schreck to divvy up their ill-gotten gains and help discredit Batman-but she also has her own scores to settle. [rovilink="P"]Paul "Pee-Wee Herman" Reubens[/rovilink], [rovilink="P110164"]Vincent Schiavelli[/rovilink] and [rovilink="P 33135"]Jan Hooks[/rovilink] play significant bits, while [rovilink="P 32458"]Pat Hingle[/rovilink] and [rovilink="P 27964"]Michael Gough[/rovilink] make returns as, respectively, Commissioner Gordon and Alfred the Butler.
synopsis.author: Hal Erickson

messages.text: Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.

synopsis.text: The producers of [rovilink="P"]Batman Begins[/rovilink] and [rovilink="V"]The Dark Knight[/rovilink] team with some of the most respected [rovilink="D"]anime[/rovilink] artists in Japan to explore Bruce Wayne's transition from tormented crime fighter to heroic icon of a crumbling metropolis. Separated into six distinct chapters but intended to be viewed as a whole, this stylized look at immortal [rovilink="O"]DC Comics[/rovilink] superhero is the result of a collaboration between [rovilink="P"]Shojiro Nishimi[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Tekkonkinkreet[/rovilink]), [rovilink="P"]Yasuhiro Aoki[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Steamboy[/rovilink]), [rovilink="P"]Futoshi Higashide[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack[/rovilink]), [rovilink="P"]Toshiyuki Kubooka[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]The Secret of Blue Water[/rovilink]), and [rovilink="P"]Hiroshi Morioka[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Chronicle of the Wings[/rovilink]).
synopsis.author: Jason Buchanan

movie.title: LEGO Batman: The Movie - DC Super Heroes Unite

synopsis.text: Jealous Lex Luthor (voice of [rovilink="P"]Clancy Brown[/rovilink]) runs for president after seeing Bruce Wayne bestowed a "Man of the Year" award, and enlists The Joker (voice of [rovilink="P"]Christopher Corey Smith[/rovilink]) to build a Black LEGO Destructor Ray. Now, in order to take down the dastardly duo, Batman (voice ot [rovilink="P"]Troy Baker[/rovilink]) seeks out the help of Superman (vioce of [rovilink="P"]Travis Willingham[/rovilink]). Despite a longstanding rivalry, the two superheroes set their differences aside to protect the people of Gotham City.
synopsis.author: Jason Buchanan

synopsis.text: [rovilink="P"]Will Arnett[/rovilink] is the caped crusader in the spin-off of [rovilink="V"]The Lego Movie[/rovilink] that features the voices of [rovilink="P"]Michael Cera[/rovilink], [rovilink="P"]Rosario Dawson[/rovilink], [rovilink="P"]Zach Galifianakis[/rovilink] and [rovilink="P"]Ralph Feinnes[/rovilink] and is directed by [rovilink="P"]Chris McKay[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Robot Chicken[/rovilink]).

messages.text: Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.
Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.

movie.title: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Part 1

synopsis.text: [rovilink="P"]Frank Miller[/rovilink]'s seminal graphic novel The Dark Knight Returns is adapted for the small screen with a sprawling [rovilink="O"]Warner Premiere[/rovilink] animated film series that finds an old and weary Bruce Wayne (voiced by [rovilink="V"]Robocop[/rovilink] himself, [rovilink="P"]Peter Weller[/rovilink]) donning the cape and cowl once again after a long retirement. Covering the final two issues of the series, [rovilink="V"]Part 2[/rovilink] pits the outlawed crusader against his nemesis, The Joker (voiced by [rovilink="V"]LOST[/rovilink]'s [rovilink="P"]Michael Emerson[/rovilink]), as well as a militarized Superman, who carries out justice in the name of the United States of America. [rovilink="P"]Ariel Winter[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Modern Family[/rovilink]) plays a female version of Robin, with [rovilink="V"]Dark Shadows[/rovilink]' [rovilink="P"]David Selby[/rovilink] rounding out the voice cast. [rovilink="P"]Jay Oliva[/rovilink] ([rovilink="V"]Green Lantern: Emerald Knights[/rovilink] directs from a script by [rovilink="P"]Bob Goodman[/rovilink].
synopsis.author: Jeremy Wheeler

synopsis.text: Batman's no-killing rule upsets Damian Wayne who is already chafing under the pressure of his mentor's tutelage. Enticed by a secret society called The Court of Owls, Damian must make a choice that will define his relationship with Batman and his future as Robin, forever.
synopsis.author: Erin Demers

synopsis.text: Behind the black cowl, Gotham City superhero Batman is really millionaire philanthropist Bruce Wayne ([rovilink="P 37277"]Michael Keaton[/rovilink]), who turned to crimefighting after his parents were brutally murdered before his eyes. The only person to share Wayne's secret is faithful butler Alfred ([rovilink="P 27964"]Michael Gough[/rovilink]). The principal villain in [rovilink="V 4278"]Batman[/rovilink] is The Joker ([rovilink="P104455"]Jack Nicholson[/rovilink]) who'd been mob torpedo Jack Napier before he was horribly disfigured in a vat of acid. The Joker's plan to destroy Batman and gain control of Gotham City is manifold. First he distributes a line of booby-trapped cosmetics, then he goes on a destruction spree in the Gotham Art Museum while the music of [rovilink="P107105"]Prince[/rovilink] blasts away in the background, and finally he orchestrates an all-out campaign to win the hearts and minds of the Gothamites, hoping to turn them against the Cowled One. Meanwhile, reporter Vicki Vale ([rovilink="P 4427"]Kim Basinger[/rovilink]) becomes the love of Batman's life-which of course plays right into the Joker's hands. Photographed by [rovilink="P107003"]Roger Pratt[/rovilink], designed by [rovilink="P 90778"]Anton Furst[/rovilink], and scored by [rovilink="P 83666"]Tim Burton[/rovilink]'s favorite composer [rovilink="P 88821"]Danny Elfman[/rovilink], [rovilink="V 4278"]Batman[/rovilink] was a monstrous box-office hit, making $100 million in the first ten days of release--$82,800,000 in North America alone. Incidentally, [rovilink="P 76383"]Billy Dee Williams[/rovilink]' comparatively small role as DA Harvey Dent was originally designed to set up the sequel, wherein Dent was to convert into master criminal Two-Face; but by the time the producers got around to that character in 1995's [rovilink="V 134815"]Batman Forever[/rovilink], Two-Face was played by [rovilink="P 36238"]Tommy Lee Jones[/rovilink].
synopsis.author: Hal Erickson

synopsis.text: [rovilink="P"]Frank Miller[/rovilink] and [rovilink="P"]David Mazzucchelli[/rovilink]'s seminal comic book series, Batman: Year One, makes its way to the animated small screen with this [rovilink="O"]Warner Premiere[/rovilink] production. The story follows James Gordon (voiced by [rovilink="P"]Bryan Cranston[/rovilink]) during his early years on the force just as the vigilante Batman ([rovilink="P"]Ben McKenzie[/rovilink]) targets both the corrupt police officials and the crime-ridden streets for a clean-up. [rovilink="P"]Eliza Dushku[/rovilink] and [rovilink="P"]Katee Sackhoff[/rovilink] lead the supporting voice cast.
synopsis.author: Jeremy Wheeler

synopsis.text: Superman and Batman join forces to rescue an elusive Kryptonian from the malevolent Darkseid in this adaptation of author [rovilink="P"]Jeff Loeb[/rovilink]'s popular Superman/Batman storyline. Shortly after a spacecraft carrying a powerful Kryptonian crashes down into Gotham Harbor, Darkseid kidnaps the extraterrestrial visitor and imprisons her in Apokolips. Rescuing the Kryptonian from Darkseid's grasp won't be easy, but thankfully Superman and Batman have just what it takes to get the job done.
synopsis.author: Jason Buchanan

synopsis.text: One of [rovilink="P116130"]John Wayne[/rovilink]'s most mystical films, [rovilink="V     2353"]Angel and the Badman[/rovilink] is also the first production that [rovilink="P116130"]Wayne[/rovilink] personally produced. The star plays a wounded outlaw who is sheltered by a Quaker family. Attracted to the family's angelic daughter [rovilink="P216446"]Gail Russell[/rovilink], the hard-bitten [rovilink="P116130"]Wayne[/rovilink] undergoes a slow and subtle character transformation; still, he is obsessed with killing the man ([rovilink="P 10100"]Bruce Cabot[/rovilink]) who murdered his foster father. The storyline traces not only the regeneration of [rovilink="P116130"]Wayne[/rovilink], but of the single-minded sheriff ([rovilink="P 10873"]Harry Carey[/rovilink]) who'd previously been determined to bring [rovilink="P116130"]Wayne[/rovilink] to justice. Not a big hit in 1947, [rovilink="V     2353"]Angel and the Badman[/rovilink] has since become the most frequently telecast of [rovilink="P116130"]John Wayne[/rovilink]'s [rovilink="O"]Republic[/rovilink] films, thanks to its lapse into Public Domain status in 1974.
synopsis.author: Hal Erickson

movie.altTitle: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice 3D
movie.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice

synopsis.text: Batman ([rovilink="P   426"]Ben Affleck[/rovilink]) and Superman ([rovilink="P302604"]Henry Cavill[/rovilink]) clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world, while the public they're defending is becoming increasingly mindful of the damage that superheroes and masked vigilantes cause. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by nefarious billionaire Lex Luthor ([rovilink="P311020"]Jesse Eisenberg[/rovilink]). Directed by [rovilink="P367818"]Zack Snyder[/rovilink], [rovilink="V   585336"]Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice[/rovilink] also co-stars [rovilink="P273224"]Amy Adams[/rovilink] as Lois Lane, [rovilink="P 34545"]Jeremy Irons[/rovilink] as Alfred the butler, and [rovilink="P626487"]Gal Gadot[/rovilink] as Wonder Woman.
synopsis.author: Jack Rodgers

messages.text: Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.
Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.

synopsis.text: This was the third follow-up to [rovilink="P 83666"]Tim Burton[/rovilink]'s [rovilink="V     4278"]Batman[/rovilink] (1989), the original revisionist look at the Gotham City legend, as well as the second in the Batman series directed by [rovilink="P110432"]Joel Schumacher[/rovilink] and the first featuring [rovilink="P 13722"]George Clooney[/rovilink] as the Caped Crusader; it features not one but two super-villains, and a new heroine to fight crime alongside Bruce Wayne (aka Batman) and Dick Grayson (aka Robin) ([rovilink="P 53411"]Chris O'Donnell[/rovilink]). The experiments of Dr. Victor Fries ([rovilink="P110501"]Arnold Schwarzenegger[/rovilink]) to preserve his late wife cryogenically have gone horribly wrong, turning him into the evil genius Mr. Freeze, who must keep his body at sub-zero temperature in order to say alive -- and he wants to put Gotham City on ice. Shy horticulturist Pamela Isley ([rovilink="P 70905"]Uma Thurman[/rovilink]) goes a bit wild with a Venus Fly Trap-like creation she's been working on and mutates into Poison Ivy, who wants to kill all the people on Earth so plants can take over. Can Batman and Robin stop these fiends before their plans go too far? Meanwhile, Bruce and Dick's faithful butler Alfred ([rovilink="P 27964"]Michael Gough[/rovilink]) isn't feeling well, so his niece Barbara ([rovilink="P 65707"]Alicia Silverstone[/rovilink]) comes to pay a visit. When Barbara finds out what her uncle's employers do in their spare time, she decides she wants in on the action, and she joins the crime fighting twosome as Batgirl. [rovilink="V   143325"]Batman & Robin[/rovilink] also features [rovilink="P 73281"]Jesse Ventura[/rovilink] in a small role as a prison guard; it would be his last film role before becoming Governor of Minnesota in 1998.
synopsis.author: Mark Deming

synopsis.text: This [rovilink="D"]animated[/rovilink] episode finds the Caped Crusader in a race against the clock against one of his greatest, most devious rivals, the Joker, who is up to no good on Halloween night. As the Joker tries to bring Gotham City down with a giant computer virus, Batman must bring down a band of evildoers looking to stop him from saving the city, a group which includes the Scarecrow, Clayface, Silver Banshee and Solomon Grundy. Fortunately, Batman has some heroic allies to help him out: Green Arrow, Nightwing and Cyborg. The collection also contains 10 [rovilink="O"]DC Nation[/rovilink] shorts, as well as a bonus cartoon from the [rovilink="O"]DC Comics[/rovilink] vault.
synopsis.author: Tom Ciampoli

messages.text: Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.
Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.

synopsis.text: Batman (voice of [rovilink="P"]Kevin Conroy[/rovilink]) does battle with a rogue's gallery of his most formidable enemies in this [rovilink="O"]DC Comics[/rovilink] adventure set in the Arkham universe. Batman has defeated The Riddler (voice of [rovilink="P"]Kevin Conroy[/rovilink]) yet again, but when a vital piece of evidence is discovered to be hidden in Arkham Asylum, the Suicide Squad descends upon the notorious sanitarium. Now, with Deadshot (voice of [rovilink="P"]Neil McDonough[/rovilink]), Harley Quinn (voice of [rovilink="P"]Hynden Walch[/rovilink]), Killer Frost (voice of [rovilink="P"]Jennifer Hale[/rovilink]), Captain Boomerang (voice of [rovilink="P"]Greg Ellis[/rovilink]), King Shark (voice of [rovilink="P"]John DiMaggio[/rovilink]), and Black Spider (voice of [rovilink="P"]Giancarlo Esposito[/rovilink]) all teaming up against him, Batman prepares for the fight of his life. Later, when The Joker (voice of [rovilink="P"]Troy Baker[/rovilink]) shows up, all hell threatens to break loose.
synopsis.author: Jason Buchanan

synopsis.text: [rovilink="P 51423"]Audie Murphy[/rovilink] continued to make 1950s-style westerns into the 1960s. In [rovilink="V    86224"]Bullet for a Badman[/rovilink], Logan Keliher ([rovilink="P 51423"]Murphy[/rovilink]) is framed for murder by onetime friend Sam Ward ([rovilink="P102103"]Darren McGavin[/rovilink]). Keliher escapes to mete out justice and to reclaim his former wife ([rovilink="P 41507"]Ruta Lee[/rovilink]), whom Ward has married. The escapee gradually comes to realize that the true villain of the piece is not his ex-friend but instead his ex-wife. [rovilink="V    86224"]A Bullet for a Badman[/rovilink] was shipped out to the lower halves of [rovilink="O"]Universal[/rovilink]'s drive-in double bills for the 1963-64 season.
synopsis.author: Hal Erickson

messages.text: Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.
Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.

synopsis.text: The Dark Knight faces off against the Dark Prince when Dracula arrives in Gotham with a nefarious plan to enslave the entire city -- including Batman, The Joker, and Penguin -- in this animated, feature-length [rovilink="D"]adventure[/rovilink].
synopsis.author: Jason Buchanan

messages.text: Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.
Not Found. : Requested resource does not exist.

synopsis.text: A veritable honor roll of famed western heroes and villains appears in the fanciful oater [rovilink="V    84318"]Badman's Country[/rovilink]. It all begins when Sheriff Pat Garrett ([rovilink="P103329"]George Montgomery[/rovilink]) draws up plans to lure the Hole-in-the-Wall Gang, headed by Butch Cassidy ([rovilink="P  8058"]Neville Brand[/rovilink]) and the Sundance Kid ([rovilink="P 35932"]Russell Johnson[/rovilink]) into a trap. To do this, he enlists the aid of fellow peacekeepers Wyatt Earp ([rovilink="P 15518"]Buster Crabbe[/rovilink]), Bat Masterson ([rovilink="P 74154"]Gregory Walcott[/rovilink]) and Buffalo Bill Cody ([rovilink="P  2742"]Malcolm Atterbury[/rovilink]). By the time everyone is introduced, the film is half over. No matter: [rovilink="V    84318"]Badman's Country[/rovilink] is redeemed by a truly impressive climactic gun duel.
synopsis.author: Hal Erickson

synopsis.text: Batwoman makes her grand entrance in the feature-length animated [rovilink="D"]adventure[/rovilink] [rovilink="V   290028"]Batman: Mystery of the Batwoman[/rovilink]. While Batman tries to figure out the new crime fighter's secret identity, Batwoman exposes an arms smuggling operation conducted by the Penguin. Soon Batwoman is captured by Bane and Batman has to choose whether or not he can trust his new mysterious ally. Featuring the voices of [rovilink="P334174"]Kelly Ripa[/rovilink], [rovilink="P 64284"]Kyra Sedgwick[/rovilink], and [rovilink="P 21552"]Hector Elizondo[/rovilink].
synopsis.author: Andrea LeVasseur

synopsis.text: Director [rovilink="P110432"]Joel Schumacher[/rovilink] inherited the Batman franchise from [rovilink="P 83666"]Tim Burton[/rovilink] and began steering it in the campier direction of the Sixties television show with this third installment. First-time Batman/Bruce Wayne ([rovilink="P 38142"]Val Kilmer[/rovilink]), in his only outing as the Caped Crusader, is effectively brooding as he ponders strange dreams about his parents' death and escapes his own near-demise at the hands of Two-Face ([rovilink="P 36238"]Tommy Lee Jones[/rovilink]), a former district attorney driven insane and turned into a master criminal when a gangster throws acid in his face.  Meanwhile, as sexy psychologist Chase Meridian ([rovilink="P 38065"]Nicole Kidman[/rovilink]) tries to analyze and seduce both Bruce Wayne and Batman, Wayne Enterprises employee Edward Nygma ([rovilink="P 11257"]Jim Carrey[/rovilink]) reacts badly to getting fired, using his self-invented mind-energy device to transform into the super-intelligent Riddler. The Riddler teams up with Two-Face to bring down Batman and drain the minds of Gotham City residents with his device, while Batman gets some much-needed help in the form of circus performer Dick Grayson ([rovilink="P 53411"]Chris O'Donnell[/rovilink]), out for vengeance after being orphaned by Two-Face.
synopsis.author: Don Kaye

movie.title: Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker

synopsis.text: The young protégé of one of the world's greatest superheroes has his first encounter with an old nemesis in this direct-to-video feature adapted from the popular animated series [rovilink="V"]Batman Beyond[/rovilink]. Terry McGinnis ([rovilink="P238959"]Will Friedle[/rovilink]) has taken over the crime-fighting responsibilities of Batman from aging Bruce Wayne ([rovilink="P 14593"]Kevin Conroy[/rovilink]), but while Terry has learned a great deal from Wayne, he's never heard the startling truth about Batman's final encounter with his arch-enemy, The Joker ([rovilink="P 29931"]Mark Hamill[/rovilink]). However, when The Joker returns to Gotham City as vicious as ever, Wayne decides that it's time that the new Batman learned all there is to know about the green-faced terror before he can bring the city to its knees -- especially after Bruce is attacked by his one-time rival. [rovilink="V   201883"]Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker[/rovilink] also features the voice talents of [rovilink="P238992"]Melissa Joan Hart[/rovilink] and [rovilink="P298973"]Angie Harmon[/rovilink]. Upon its initial release, the movie sparked some controversy among [rovilink="V"]Batman Beyond[/rovilink] fans because of last-minute edits that toned down the violence level. However, it was eventually released on DVD in an uncut format.
synopsis.author: Mark Deming

synopsis.text: Lex Luthor has been elected President of the United States, he's using an earthbound Kryptonite asteroid as grounds for declaring a $1 billion bounty on the heads of Superman and Batman. Now, the two heroes must team up to save both the planet and their own necks. They can't do it on their own, but finding help won't be easy because every hero and villain on the planet is looking to collect that juicy bounty. Upon learning that Luthor's criminal ambition reaches well beyond the borders of North America, Superman and Batman realize that clearing their good names may be the least of their worries.
synopsis.author: Jason Buchanan

synopsis.text: This documentary is set on the Ganges at Benares. The Ganges is the sacred river of the Hindus. It is visited by Hindus from around the world and tourists. At Benares, as in other riverside places, the locals cremate their dead and release their ashes into the water. They also perform many other religious rites and ceremonies. Amidst the ashes of the dead, and the occasional sunken corpse, the devoted come to bathe, drink, and pray in the holy water. In one scene, a boy washes his bicycle in the river as a corpse is sunk next to him. The film is narrated by Gopal, a boatman who provides his often humorous commentary upon the daily activities. Included are his discussions of how the locals bilk the tourists.
synopsis.author: Sandra Brennan

synopsis.text: After Bruce Wayne ([rovilink="P"]Jason O'Mara[/rovilink]) is kidnapped by Talia al Ghul ([rovilink="P"]Morena Baccarin[/rovilink]), it's up to Dick Grayson ([rovilink="P"]Sean Maher[/rovilink]), Katherine Kane ([rovilink="P"]Yvonne Strahovski[/rovilink]) and Damian Wayne ([rovilink="P"]Stuart Allen[/rovilink]) to assume their bat-identities and join forces with Batwing ([rovilink="P"]Gaius Charles[/rovilink]) to protect Gotham in his absence.
synopsis.author: Violet LeVoit

synopsis.text: The origins of the Caped Crusader of Gotham City are finally brought to the big screen in this new adaptation of the perennially popular comic-book series. The young Bruce Wayne ([rovilink="P404670"]Gus Lewis[/rovilink]) leads a privileged life as the son of wealthy, philanthropist parents, both of whom stress their commitment to improving the lives of the citizens of crime-ridden Gotham City. After his mother and father are murdered by a mugger, however, Wayne grows into an impudent young man ([rovilink="P  3538"]Christian Bale[/rovilink]), full of rage and bent on retribution until encouraged by his childhood sweetheart, Rachel Dawes ([rovilink="P225994"]Katie Holmes[/rovilink]), to search for answers beyond his own personal vendettas. Wayne eventually finds discipline in the Far East under the tutelage of Henri Ducard ([rovilink="P 52070"]Liam Neeson[/rovilink]), a member of the mysterious League of Shadows who guides him in the study of martial arts -- and the ways in which an ordinary man can hone his senses to an almost superhuman acuity. After seven years away from Gotham, Wayne returns, determined to bring peace and safety back to the city. With the help of his faithful manservant, Alfred Pennyworth ([rovilink="P 10198"]Michael Caine[/rovilink]), and Lucius Fox ([rovilink="P 90514"]Morgan Freeman[/rovilink]), a scientist at his late father's corporation, Wayne develops a secret identity as Batman, a masked fighter for justice. But when a shady psychiatrist ([rovilink="P271775"]Cillian Murphy[/rovilink]) joins forces with the criminal underworld, Wayne realizes that putting an end to their nefarious plans will be very difficult indeed. [rovilink="V   289465"]Batman Begins[/rovilink] also features [rovilink="P 53946"]Gary Oldman[/rovilink] as Lt. James Gordon and [rovilink="P 76333"]Tom Wilkinson[/rovilink] as the crime boss Carmine Falcone.
synopsis.author: Mark Deming

synopsis.text: In 1942, [rovilink="O"]Metro-Goldwyn-Meyer[/rovilink] and the United States Office of War Information collaborated on [rovilink="V"]Bataan[/rovilink] with the official goal to increase public understanding of World War II. The first war film to take place entirely on the battlefield -- with no scenes of the soldiers on leave, depictions of the home front, or flashbacks to pre-war civilian life -- [rovilink="V"]Bataan[/rovilink] prepared its wartime audience for American casualties. Its Alamo-esque storyline emphasized the value of such sacrifice and its diverse group of soldiers --compiled of all ranks, races, classes, ages, and creeds -- portrayed this effort as the duty of all men. It is a depiction of altruism and national unity that both inspired public support of the War and served as the template for World War II films throughout the forties and into the present.
synopsis.author: Aubry Anne D'Arminio

synopsis.text: In this [rovilink="D"]animated[/rovilink] feature, Batman must enlist the help of his superhero allies to defeat a dangerous gang of animal-themed criminals led by his arch nemesis Penguin.
synopsis.author: Daniel Gelb
